result.execSummary:
The defendant Travis J. Adams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge
Cash bond to be applied towards restitution; COC office to pay out restitution in full
Payment plan; $50.00/month commencing on April 1, 2019

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Travis J. Adams

records.addlTxt: Payment plan should not have started until 2019
to Court from Atty Gumz

Plea and Sentencing on March 22, 2018
Reporter: Jill Bartol
Request Denied
to Court from Travis Adams
Commitment returned
Supplement to Disposition (Restitution) w/ Receipt

Defendant Travis J. Adams in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Travis J. Adams in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee questions the court on the preliminary hearing.  Court did conduct a waiver of prelim.  Atty Hendee amends the charge to remove the repeater.    Atty Hendee states plea agreement to the amended charge.  
Atty Gumz agrees.
BY THE COURT: Charge will be amended to remove the repeater.

Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.    
Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made freely, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of the amended charge.

Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Amended Ct. 1 (remove the repeater): Court orders 6 months in the Marquette County Jail 
Credit = 135 days
Time Served Sentence
Court Costs = $268.00
DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
Restitution = $928.72 + $92.87 surcharge
Cash bond be applied towards restitution 
COC office to pay out Restitution in full.
  
Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing on April 1, 2018

  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.

Defendant is remanded into custody due to the PO Hold.
Return date on March 22, 2018 at 09:45 am.

Attorney Mark Jay Gumz in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz states that the defendant is in custody; requests a reset.

BY THE COURT:  Reset  Return date scheduled for March 22, 2018 at 09:45 am.
order to cancel commitment returned
Based on appearance: 02-05-2018
Return date on March 8, 2018 at 01:45 pm.

Defendant Travis J. Adams in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Mark Jay Gumz appeared by phone means for Defendant Travis J. Adams. Prosecuting Atty Chad A. Hendee appeared for State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the defendant was brought here from California.
BY THE COURT:  Warrant satisfied.

Atty Hendee requests a $2,500 cash bond with conditions.
Atty Gumz responds.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $2,500 cash bond with conditions.
Set for Return  Return date scheduled for March 8, 2018 at 01:45 pm.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Judgment of bail/bond forfeiture
Notice of Bail/Bond Forfeiture
to be forfeited in 30 days if no response

Attorney Mark Jay Gumz in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz states that he does not know why his client is not here today as he spoke with him and his mother this morning.   Atty Hendee requests warrant based on defendant's failure to appear.  

BY THE COURT:  Warrant will issue.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 07-23-2015 03:00 pm
Jury trial on June 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Travis J. Adams in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Travis J. Adams in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that in speaking with Atty Gumz; the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today.  Atty Gumz agrees and has discussed the waiver of the Prelim with the defendant.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

  Atty Hendee files the information with the court.    Defendant received a copy of the information & waives it's reading.   Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  Atty Gumz requests a trial date.
  
BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.
bond continued.  Jury trial scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Travis J. Adams in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Travis J. Adams in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz states his motion.  States his client is on an extended supervision hold until 3/13/15 and requests bond be amended to $100 cash.  Atty Hendee opposes any reduction in bond.  
BY THE COURT:  Motion to modify cash bond is denied at this time.
for Modification of Bail
Letter from DA dated 12-26-14 w/enc
Bail/bond hearing on January 7, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on February 18, 2015 at 10:30 am.
*No conditions

Defendant Travis J. Adams in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz appearing by telephone.  Defendant Travis J. Adams in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Atty Hendee requests a $1,000 cash bond; no conditions requested.
Atty Gumz states that the defendant is employed and lives in Montello.  Atty Gumz requests a signature bond.  

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 cash bond; no conditions.

Court questions Atty Gumz regarding the Prelim.
Atty Gumz waives the time limits for the Prelim.
BY THE COURT:  Time limits waived; set for Prelim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 18, 2015 at 10:30 am.
